content: To insert an image file in HTML, you can use the "img" tag. The "img" tag does not require a closing tag and must include the "src" attribute, which specifies the path to the image file. You can also include optional attributes such as "alt" to provide alternative text for the image and "width" and "height" to specify the dimensions of the image. Here is an example of how to insert an image file in HTML: ```css ``` In the above example, replace "path/to/image.jpg" with the actual path to your image file. You can also adjust the values of "width" and "height" to the appropriate dimensions for your image.
